meanings.sent1: After failing the test, she had to requalify by studying harder.
meanings.sent2: He needs to requalify for the job by updating his skills.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to requalify for the title of 'best mouse catcher' by practicing daily.
meanings.sent4: The athlete had to requalify for the race after recovering from an injury.
meanings.sent5: In order to requalify for the competition, she had to prove her abilities once more.

meanings.definition: To meet the necessary requirements again
meanings.sent1: To keep his license, he must requalify every year.
meanings.sent2: She had to requalify for the scholarship by maintaining good grades.
meanings.sent3: The robot had to requalify for the dance competition by fixing its malfunctioning circuits.
meanings.sent4: The team had to requalify for the tournament by winning the qualifying matches.
meanings.sent5: In order to requalify for the program, he needed to submit his application before the deadline.
